org.parosproxy.paros.extension

Interface Extension

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExtensionActiveScan, ExtensionAdaptor, ExtensionAlert, ExtensionAntiCSRF, ExtensionAPI, ExtensionAuthentication, ExtensionAuthorization, ExtensionAutoUpdate, ExtensionBreak, ExtensionCallback, ExtensionCompare, ExtensionDynSSL, ExtensionEdit, ExtensionEncoder2, ExtensionExtension, ExtensionFilter, ExtensionForcedUser, ExtensionGlobalExcludeURL, ExtensionHelp, ExtensionHistory, ExtensionHttpPanelComponentAll, ExtensionHttpPanelHexView, ExtensionHttpPanelImageView, ExtensionHttpPanelLargeRequestView, ExtensionHttpPanelLargeResponseView, ExtensionHttpPanelRequestFormTableView, ExtensionHttpPanelRequestQueryCookieTableView, ExtensionHttpPanelSyntaxHighlightTextView, ExtensionHttpSessions, ExtensionKeyboard, ExtensionLog4j, ExtensionManualRequestEditor, ExtensionOption, ExtensionParams, ExtensionPassiveScan, ExtensionProxies, ExtensionReport, ExtensionRequestPostTableView, ExtensionRuleConfig, ExtensionScript, ExtensionSearch, ExtensionSessionManagement, ExtensionSitesRefresh, ExtensionSpider, ExtensionState, ExtensionStats, ExtensionStdMenus, ExtensionUiUtils, ExtensionUserManagement

    public interface Extension
    Life cycle for an extension . init . initModel - the extension obtain the data model . initXML . getExtensionHook - workbench obtain the view of the plugin . start() . stop() . May go back to 5 depending on options or menu chosen. . destroy

      void databaseOpen(Database db)
      Implement this method to register database tables to be used by the add-on
      void destroy()
      Plugin cleanup, finalize etc when program shutdown.
      List<String> getActiveActions()
      Returns the (internationalised) names of all active actions of the extension - if there are any the user will be given the option not to exit ZAP or, if the extension is bundled in an add-on that's being updated or uninstalled, not to continue with the changes.

      Returns the add-on where this extension is bundled.

      Tells whether or not this extension is enabled.

      Called after the options for this extension have been loaded, so that the extension can make use of them.

      Implement this method to perform tasks after all extensions/add-ons have been initialised.

      Start the plugin eg if there is a running server.
      void stop()
      stop the plugin eg if there is a running server.
      boolean supportsDb(String type)
      Return true if the specified db type is supported by the extension (or if it doesnt use any db) If this method returns false (meaning the db in use is not supported) then the extension will not be loaded.
      boolean supportsLowMemory()
      Return true it the extension can run with the 'low memory' option.
      void unload()
      Unloads any component manually added to ZAP or other extensions (that is, a component that was not added through the ExtensionHook).

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the name of the extension, for configurations and access from other components (e.g. extensions).
        Returns:
        the name of the extension, never null
        See Also:
        getUIName()

      • getUIName

        String getUIName()
        Returns a short descriptive name of the extension, to be shown in UI components. The name must be internationalised.
        Returns:
        the UI name of the extension, never null
        Since:
        2.4.0
        See Also:
        getName(), getDescription()

      • getDescription

        String getDescription()
        Returns the description of the extension, to be shown in UI components. The description must be internationalised.
        Returns:
        the description of the extension, never null

      • getVersion

        Version getVersion()
        Returns the (semantic) version of this extension, null if not versioned
        Returns:
        the version of the extension, or null if not versioned
        Since:
        2.4.0

      • init

        void init()
        Initialize plugin during startup. This phase is carried out before all others.

      • initModel

        void initModel(Model model)
        Initialization of plugin after obtaining data model from core. Method should not depend on view.
        Parameters:
        model - the model

      • initView

        void initView(ViewDelegate view)

      • getModel

        Model getModel()

      • getView

        ViewDelegate getView()

      • start

        void start()
        Start the plugin eg if there is a running server.

      • stop

        void stop()
        stop the plugin eg if there is a running server.

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        Plugin cleanup, finalize etc when program shutdown. Stop() will be called before shutdown.

      • initXML

        void initXML(Session session,
             OptionsParam options)
        Initialize session and options parameter if required XML node not in either files.
        Parameters:
        session - the current session
        options - the options

      • hook

        void hook(ExtensionHook pluginHook)

      • getExtensionHook

        ExtensionHook getExtensionHook()
        Gets the ExtensionHook used to hook the components during initialisation.

        Should be called only by core functionality (e.g. to unload the hooked components).

        Returns:
        the ExtensionHook used to hook the components.
        Since:
        2.6.0
        See Also:
        hook(ExtensionHook)

      • isDepreciated

        boolean isDepreciated()

      • getOrder

        int getOrder()

      • setOrder

        void setOrder(int order)

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Tells whether or not this extension is enabled.

        Extensions might be disabled by the user (for example, through GUI), or, automatically during loading if all its dependencies are not fulfilled.

        Returns:
        true if the extension is enabled, false otherwise.

      • setEnabled

        void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether or not this extension is enabled.

        Note: This method should be called only by bootstrap classes.

        Parameters:
        enabled - true if the extension should be enabled, false otherwise.

      • getDependencies

        List<Class<? extends Extension>> getDependencies()
        Gets the list of Extensions that this extension depends on.
        Returns:
        the list of dependencies, empty (or null) if none.

      • isCore

        boolean isCore()

      • getAuthor

        String getAuthor()

      • getURL

        URL getURL()

      • getMessages

        ResourceBundle getMessages()

      • setMessages

        void setMessages(ResourceBundle messages)

      • getI18nPrefix

        String getI18nPrefix()

      • setI18nPrefix

        void setI18nPrefix(String prefix)

      • optionsLoaded

        void optionsLoaded()
        Called after the options for this extension have been loaded, so that the extension can make use of them. Note that other add-ons may not have been loaded at this point - if you need them to be then implement postInit()
        See Also:
        postInit()

      • canUnload

        boolean canUnload()

      • unload

        void unload()
        Unloads any component manually added to ZAP or other extensions (that is, a component that was not added through the ExtensionHook).

        Should be called only by core functionality (e.g. during uninstallation of the extension).

        See Also:
        hook(ExtensionHook)

      • getUnsavedResources

        List<String> getUnsavedResources()
        Extensions should return the user friendly names of any unsaved resources - if there are any the user will be given the option not to exit ZAP or, if the extension is bundled in an add-on that's being updated or uninstalled, not to continue with the changes.
        Returns:
        a List containing the unsaved resources or null if none
        Since:
        2.2.0
        See Also:
        getActiveActions()

      • getActiveActions

        List<String> getActiveActions()
        Returns the (internationalised) names of all active actions of the extension - if there are any the user will be given the option not to exit ZAP or, if the extension is bundled in an add-on that's being updated or uninstalled, not to continue with the changes.

        An active action is something that's started by the user, for example, a scan.

        Returns:
        a List containing the active actions or null if none
        Since:
        2.4.0
        See Also:
        getUnsavedResources()

      • postInstall

        void postInstall()
        Implement this method to perform tasks after the add-on is installed. Note that this will only be called if the user adds the add-on via ZAP, eg file the File menu or the Marketplace. If the add-on is installed by copying the file to the plugins directory then it will not be called.
        Since:
        2.3.0
        See Also:
        postInit()

      • postInit

        void postInit()
        Implement this method to perform tasks after all extensions/add-ons have been initialised.
        Since:
        2.4.0
        See Also:
        postInstall()

      • databaseOpen

        void databaseOpen(Database db)
           throws DatabaseException,
                  DatabaseUnsupportedException
        Implement this method to register database tables to be used by the add-on
        Parameters:
        db - the database opened
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - if an error occurred while reading the database contents
        DatabaseUnsupportedException - if the database is not supported by the extension

      • getAddOn

        AddOn getAddOn()
        Returns the add-on where this extension is bundled. Might be null if core extension.
        Returns:
        the add-on where this extension is bundled, or null if core extension.
        Since:
        2.4.0

      • setAddOn

        void setAddOn(AddOn addOn)
        Sets the add-on where this extension is bundled.

        Note: This method should be called only by bootstrap classes.

        Parameters:
        addOn - the add-on where this extension is bundled
        Since:
        2.4.0

      • supportsDb

        boolean supportsDb(String type)
        Return true if the specified db type is supported by the extension (or if it doesnt use any db) If this method returns false (meaning the db in use is not supported) then the extension will not be loaded.
        Parameters:
        type - the db type
        Returns:
        true if the specified db type is supported by the extension (or if it doesnt use any db)
        See Also:
        Database.getType()

      • supportsLowMemory

        boolean supportsLowMemory()
        Return true it the extension can run with the 'low memory' option. If the low memory option is set (and the extension supports it) then code should minimize the data stored in memory, using the db for all significant data. Extensions that do not support the low memory option will not be run if the option is set.
        Returns:
        true if the extension support the 'low memory' option, false otherwise
